ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic presentation with multiple cafe-au-lait spots, plexiform and spinal neurofibromas, and scoliosis. All four phenotypic features are cardinal manifestations of NF1.
A variant form of neurofibromatosis that can present with similar features to NF1 including neurofibromas and cafe-au-lait spots, though less common.
Presents with multiple cafe-au-lait spots similar to NF1, but typically lacks neurofibromas. The presence of plexiform and spinal neurofibromas makes this less likely.
Can present with cafe-au-lait spots and skeletal abnormalities including scoliosis, but the spots typically have irregular borders and neurofibromas are not a feature.
Can rarely present with cafe-au-lait spots resembling NF1, but neurofibromas are uncommon and other features like early-onset malignancies would be expected.
